definitions.definition: To confuse or overpower the sight of (someone or something, such as a sensor) by means of excessive brightness .
examples: Dazzled by the headlights of the lorry, the deer stopped in the middle of the street.
Antidrone lasers can burn or dazzle a drone's sensors.

definitions.definition: To render incapable of thinking clearly; to overwhelm with showiness or brilliance.
examples: The delegates were dazzled by the originality of his arguments.

definitions.definition: To be overpowered by light; to be confused by excess of brightness.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To confuse or overpower the sight of (someone or something, such as a sensor) by means of excessive brightness .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , figuratively ) To render incapable of thinking clearly; to overwhelm with showiness or brilliance.
( intransitive ) To be overpowered by light; to be confused by excess of brightness.
